p: Many scientific works have been undertaken to find an indicator of contamination for these pathogens. The proposals arising from these approaches are varied and not consistent. Many of the authors ( Muniain-Mujika et al., 2003, Skraber et al., 2004) have concluded that the fecal coliphages could be satisfactory indicators, in any case better than all the bacteriological indicators. Some authors have concluded the ability of some enteric viruses to play this role of indicator. For this purpose the enteroviruses are the most frequently proposed according. In addition, no particular indicator appears to be unanimous for the moment ( Pina et al., 1998).
